briefdescription.para: Default ctor.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxHW_DEFAULT_STYLE, const wxString &name="htmlWindow")
memberdef.name: wxHtmlWindow

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: The parameters are the same as wxScrolled::wxScrolled() constructor.

briefdescription.para: Appends HTML fragment to currently displayed text and refreshes the window.

simplesect.para: false if an error occurred, true otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to the top-level container.

simplesect.para: Cells and Containers, Printing Framework Overview

briefdescription.para: Returns anchor within currently opened page (see wxHtmlWindow::GetOpenedPage).

detaileddescription.para: If no page is opened or if the displayed page wasn't produced by call to LoadPage(), empty string is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns full location of the opened page.

detaileddescription.para: If no page is opened or if the displayed page wasn't produced by call to LoadPage(), empty string is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns title of the opened page or wxEmptyString if the current page does not contain <TITLE> tag.
Returns a pointer to the current parser.
Returns the related frame.
Moves back to the previous page.

detaileddescription.para: Only pages displayed using LoadPage() are stored in history list.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if it is possible to go back in the history i.e.

detaileddescription.para: HistoryBack() won't fail.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if it is possible to go forward in the history i.e.

detaileddescription.para: HistoryForward() won't fail.

briefdescription.para: Clears history.
Moves to next page in history.

detaileddescription.para: Only pages displayed using LoadPage() are stored in history list.

briefdescription.para: Loads an HTML page from a file and displays it.

simplesect.para: false if an error occurred, true otherwise

briefdescription.para: Unlike SetPage() this function first loads the HTML page from location and then displays it.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the document. See the wxFileSystem Overview for details on the address format and wxFileSystem for a description of how the file is opened.

simplesect.para: false if an error occurred, true otherwise

briefdescription.para: Called when user clicks on hypertext link.

detaileddescription.para: Default behaviour is to emit a wxHtmlLinkEvent and, if the event was not processed or skipped, call LoadPage() and do nothing else.
Overloading this method is deprecated; intercept the event instead.
Also see wxHtmlLinkInfo.

briefdescription.para: Called when an URL is being opened (either when the user clicks on a link or an image is loaded).

detaileddescription.para: The URL will be opened only if OnOpeningURL() returns wxHTML_OPEN. This method is called by wxHtmlParser::OpenURL.
You can override OnOpeningURL() to selectively block some URLs (e.g. for security reasons) or to redirect them elsewhere. Default behaviour is to always return wxHTML_OPEN.

type
Indicates type of the resource. Is one of
wxHTML_URL_PAGE: Opening a HTML page.
wxHTML_URL_IMAGE: Opening an image.
wxHTML_URL_OTHER: Opening a resource that doesn't fall into any other category.
url
URL being opened.
redirect
Pointer to wxString variable that must be filled with an URL if OnOpeningURL() returns wxHTML_REDIRECT.
The return value is:
wxHTML_OPEN: Open the URL.
wxHTML_BLOCK: Deny access to the URL, wxHtmlParser::OpenURL will return NULL.
wxHTML_REDIRECT: Don't open url, redirect to another URL. OnOpeningURL() must fill *redirect with the new URL. OnOpeningURL() will be called again on returned URL.

briefdescription.para: Called on parsing <TITLE> tag.
This reads custom settings from wxConfig.

detaileddescription.para: It uses the path 'path' if given, otherwise it saves info into currently selected path. The values are stored in sub-path wxHtmlWindow. Read values: all things set by SetFonts(), SetBorders().

parameterdescription.para: wxConfig from which you want to read the configuration.
Optional path in config tree. If not given current path is used.

briefdescription.para: Selects all text in the window.
Selects the line of text that pos points at.

detaileddescription.para: Note that pos is relative to the top of displayed page, not to window's origin, use wxScrolled::CalcUnscrolledPosition() to convert physical coordinate.

briefdescription.para: Selects the word at position pos.

detaileddescription.para: Note that pos is relative to the top of displayed page, not to window's origin, use wxScrolled::CalcUnscrolledPosition() to convert physical coordinate.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current selection as plain text.

detaileddescription.para: Returns an empty string if no text is currently selected.

briefdescription.para: This function sets the space between border of window and HTML contents.

detaileddescription.para: See image:

briefdescription.para: This function sets font sizes and faces.

detaileddescription.para: See wxHtmlDCRenderer::SetFonts for detailed description.

briefdescription.para: Sets default font sizes and/or default font size.

detaileddescription.para:
See wxHtmlDCRenderer::SetStandardFonts for detailed description.
SetFonts()

briefdescription.para: Sets the source of a page and displays it, for example:

detaileddescription.para: If you want to load a document from some location use LoadPage() instead.

simplesect.para: false if an error occurred, true otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the frame in which page title will be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: format is the format of the frame title, e.g. "HtmlHelp : %s". It must contain exactly one s. This s is substituted with HTML page title.

briefdescription.para: After calling SetRelatedFrame(), this sets statusbar slot where messages will be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: (Default is -1 = no messages.)

briefdescription.para: Sets the associated statusbar where messages will be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: Call this instead of SetRelatedFrame() if you want statusbar updates only, no changing of the frame title.

briefdescription.para: Returns content of currently displayed page as plain text.
Saves custom settings into wxConfig.

detaileddescription.para: It uses the path 'path' if given, otherwise it saves info into currently selected path. Regardless of whether the path is given or not, the function creates sub-path wxHtmlWindow.
Saved values: all things set by SetFonts(), SetBorders().

parameterdescription.para: wxConfig to which you want to save the configuration.
Optional path in config tree. If not given, the current path is used.

briefdescription.para: Adds input filter to the static list of available filters.

detaileddescription.para:
These filters are present by default:
text/html MIME type
image/* MIME types
Plain Text filter (this filter is used if no other filter matches)

memberdef.argsstring: (wxHtmlCell *cell, wxCoord x, wxCoord y, const wxMouseEvent &event)
memberdef.name: OnCellClicked

briefdescription.para: This method is called when a mouse button is clicked inside wxHtmlWindow.

detaileddescription.para: The default behaviour is to emit a wxHtmlCellEvent and, if the event was not processed or skipped, call OnLinkClicked() if the cell contains an hypertext link.
Overloading this method is deprecated; intercept the event instead.

parameterdescription.para: The cell inside which the mouse was clicked, always a simple (i.e. non-container) cell
The logical x coordinate of the click point
The logical y coordinate of the click point
The mouse event containing other information about the click

simplesect.para: true if a link was clicked, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This method is called when a mouse moves over an HTML cell.

detaileddescription.para: Default behaviour is to emit a wxHtmlCellEvent.
Overloading this method is deprecated; intercept the event instead.

parameterdescription.para: The cell inside which the mouse is currently, always a simple (i.e. non-container) cell
The logical x coordinate of the click point
The logical y coordinate of the click point

briefdescription.para: wxHtmlWindow is probably the only class you will directly use unless you want to do something special (like adding new tag handlers or MIME filters).

detaileddescription.para: The purpose of this class is to display rich content pages (either local file or downloaded via HTTP protocol) in a window based on a subset of the HTML standard. The width of the window is constant - given in the constructor - and virtual height is changed dynamically depending on page size. Once the window is created you can set its content by calling SetPage() with raw HTML, LoadPage() with a wxFileSystem location or LoadFile() with a filename.

simplesect.para: If you want complete HTML/CSS support as well as a Javascript engine, see instead wxWebView.

wxHtmlWindow uses the wxImage class for displaying images, as such you need to initialize the handlers for any image formats you use before loading a page. See wxInitAllImageHandlers and wxImage::AddHandler.

detaileddescription.para: This class supports the following styles:

listitem.para: wxHW_SCROLLBAR_NEVER: Never display scrollbars, not even when the page is larger than the window.
wxHW_SCROLLBAR_AUTO: Display scrollbars only if page's size exceeds window's size.
wxHW_NO_SELECTION: Don't allow the user to select text.

detaileddescription.para: The following event handler macros redirect the events to member function handlers 'func' with prototypes like: voidhandlerFuncName(wxHtmlCellEvent&event) or voidhandlerFuncName( wxHtmlLinkEvent&event)

Event macros for events emitted by this class:
EVT_HTML_CELL_CLICKED(id, func): A wxHtmlCell was clicked.
EVT_HTML_CELL_HOVER(id, func): The mouse passed over a wxHtmlCell.
EVT_HTML_LINK_CLICKED(id, func): A wxHtmlCell which contains an hyperlink was clicked.
